column5: I wish to thank all those who gave me all the contacts and tips. If I can't find something that will work for us I will be shocked with all the information provided. Very much appreciated!
Check out Paquettes camp.com near Chapleau Ontario, has a few smaller cabins. They have always been good to us with very fair rates.

The Landings on Redgut Bay of Canadian Rainy Lake. Young's at Nestor Falls Lake of the Woods. If you really want to get out in the woods try Agimac Resort on Indian Lake. Another out in the woods trip is Separation Lake Lodge on the English River north of Kenora. Drive to their campground and boat out to lodge about 5 miles. They will lead you out. Separation is a personal favorite of mine.I used to do the Lac Suel trips, but I like the more remote resorts. For me it's a better quality trip experience and no big water to deal with when the wind kicks up.

Lac Seul Lodge had a couple open dates left for their small two man cottage a week ago. Could be gone by now. Nice cabin for a couple or two people. Two double beds. Wife and I stay there and like it.Pooch
Pine Point or Lac des Mille Lodge Both on on Lac des Mille Lake in Upsala Ontario.
Drop a line to Linda at Moosehorn Lodge - [email protected] Cabin 1 is a cozy getaway for two people and the fishing is what you are looking for. Lots of great options out there, good luck!
Another vote for Frog Rapids camp. Nice folks, clean cabins, good fishing. Lac Seul is a short drive if you bring your own boat.

No need to look any further than Young's Wilderness Camp on LOTW. Five or so minute drive north of Nestor Falls. Excellent Walleye, Smallmouth, Pike and Muskie fishing, excellent camp with rustic looking (outside) fully modern cabins. Excellent boats/motors or bring your own, electricity at the dock for batt chargers. Great food, great staff, great fishing, great place! (http://youngswildernesscamp.com/)Call Perry or Carol: 1-866-894-0674 - Toll Free available from the U.S. only
Check out Timber Edge Camps on Minnitaki/Butterfly Lake by Sioux Lookout sounds like what you are looking for.
Lower twin lakes lodge in Nakina,great people,nice place John and Karin.https://www.lowertwinlakes.com/

Gawley's Little Beaver Lodge just south of Ear Falls Ontario on Lac Seul is a great place to stay and can accommodate a group of two. We do well on the walleyes, and catch an occasional smallie, as well as some good sized pike, while fishing for walleye. I think there is a fair population of smallmouth accessible on that part of Lac Seul, but our group doesn't really know how to target them. They have free launching and docking with electric on the dock. Free unlimited ice, minnows available, clean cabins. PM me if you have further questions on the camp or that part of Lac Seul.
My wife and I have been fishing Lac Seul out of Whitewing Resort for the past 13 years. Very nice, well maintained camp with clean, modern cabins. Check it out at www.whitewingresort.com
Check out Gow-Bush-Kon Lodge, great walleye and small mouth fishing.Great boats and comfortable cabins.
Take a look at Golden Hook Camp on Gullrock Lake in Northwestern Ontario.. Near the town of Red Lake. They have two person cottages.. Great walleye fishing.

My friend and I are looking for a new Canadian fishing lodge and two person cabin rentals seem to be in short supply. Do any of you WC folks know of any possible destinations? We want a drive to location with good walleye and smallmouth fishing. Thanks for any leads.
Check Evergreen Lodge, Pat has small 1 bedroom cabins that's located in Ear Falls. Great walleye and can be good for smallies.
Check out separation lake lodge great walleye and smallmouth plus big pike, located just north of kenora on the english river
Check with V-Bay Gord. I think he has a smaller cabin that may be great for two people. Eagle Lake has all the species a person could want.PjShorthorn.
www.birchdalelodge.com on Eagle Lake 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcel, he has cabins to accommodate you.
Another vote for Evergreen

Clark's Resorts on Cedar Lake or the Indian lake chain.Good fishing for walleye, Musky, and SMB.Nice cabins with reasonable rates and they will book 2 people.http://clarksresorts.com/pages/view/drive-in-resorts
Deer Path Lodge. Hudson Ontario. Great Smallmouth fishing on Big Vermillion. Short drive to Lac Seul for super walleye fishing.
Frog Rapids Camp in Sioux Lookout has several small cabins and great walleye and small mouth fishing on Minitaki.

Some places have cabins available for small groups in non-prime time. I understand prime time is generally from opening to July 4. That may vary from lodge to lodge. My son and I go in the fall and have no issues getting a cabin.
